results.title: The Luddite's tale
results.creator_credit: Myfanwy Thompson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Myfawny Thompson is perplexed by technology, especially the need to text to communicate. After helping her mother move house, Thomspon starts to realise what a wonderful gift technology can be.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Myfanwy Thompson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Myfawny Thompson is perplexed by technology, especially the need to text to communicate. After helping her mother move house, Thomspon starts to realise what a wonderful gift technology can be.
description_for_label: Myfawny Thompson is perplexed by technology, especially the need to text to communicate. After helping her mother move house, Thomspon starts to realise what a wonderful gift technology can be.

results.title: In search of adventure
results.creator_credit: Kirsty McGeoch, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: After five years of study, Kirsty McGeoch had a law degree and a lifetime of career achievements ahead. Something, however, was telling her not to do it and to follow another path. Ultimately, this story is about honouring what fulfils the spirit.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kirsty McGeoch, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Frocks on the docks
results.creator_credit: Liz Orr, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Liz Orr talks about the dress she bought between curtain calls, the fundraiser for Heather Osland’s defence and the fight to keep the union strong on Melbourne’s docks.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Liz Orr, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Will to live
results.creator_credit: Val Colbert, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Fragile at birth and not meant to live, Val Colbert’s mother went the extra step to keep her alive. This story is dedicated to Colbert’s mum’s tenacity and eternal strength.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Val Colbert, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: A Nana fish
results.creator_credit: Mullie Watson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Originally from Cherbourg, Mullie Watson tells of his fond memories of his nan, about the day they went fishing together and how an owl became his totem.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mullie Watson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Hoop culture
results.brief_description: Created in response to a class assignment to offer a visual interpretation of ‘cultural identity’, this short After Effects animation focuses itself on different aspects of the ‘hoop culture’ of amateur basketball around melbourne.

results.title: Talks: a Natimuk Primary School animation
results.creator_credit: Dave Jones and Natimuk Primary School
results.brief_description: A collaboration between students from Natimuk Primary School and animation artists Dave Jones funded as part of the Arts Victoria Artists in Schools program. Hand drawn crayon drawings are animated and Combined with recorded soundgrabs from the kids to make an engaging sequence of simple, colourful character studies!
results.description: A collaboration between students from Natimuk Primary School and animation artists Dave Jones funded as part of the Arts Victoria Artists in Schools program. results.title: Fair go!
results.creator_credit: Tony Wright, Penny Robbins, Open Channel Productions and Peter Moon
results.brief_description: “Fair go!” is a step towards meeting the needs of young people for information about their rights as workers. Using a fresh, entertaining presentation, the program follows the experiences of school-leavers Kelly and Sam, as they fall unawares into a series of near disasters in new jobs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Wright, Penny Robbins, Open Channel Productions and Peter Moon
